newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thailand cuts taxes to boost offshore banking.
newsitem.headline: Thailand cuts taxes to boost offshore banking.

text.p: The Thai cabinet has approved a finance ministry proposal to scrap and cut banking taxes to help boost offshore banking activities and make Bangkok a regional financial hub.
An official at Government House said the cabinet lifted a 10 percent withholding tax on profits derived from out-out offshore banking business that are remitted abroad by Thai-based banks.
It also waived a 10 percent income tax on revenue from syndication of out-out loans.
Out-out loans refer to the borrowing and import of offshore funds for relending to foreign clients outside Thailand.
The official said the government also agreed to scrap a 10 percent withholding tax on interest paid on selected incoming offshore loans tapped by Thai state enterprises.
The official said the tax cuts would help Thailand compete with Singapore and Hong Kong in hosting regional offshore banking business.
He said the government hoped the tax cuts would boost current low volumes of out-out loans arranged by 48 Thai-based offshore banking units.
